page.title: 01Deadwater Burn & Ravenshill
page.content: The Domesday Block GR 03600594 is set for the most part in the moorland which forms the natural border between England and Scotland. Through the centre of the block flows the {Deadwater Burn,}which rises to the north, on Deadwater Moor. Steep wooded slopes rise to east and west of the Burn.{Ravenshill Moor}at around 400 metres above sea level, is a ridge falling southwards from{Deadwater} {Fell,}the rocky summit of which rises to 569 metres. In the valley the road,disused railway line and Burn crowd together,with a little grazing land available to the north of Kielder Village. Cattle and sheep also graze on the rough grassland around{Deadwater Farm,} whilst the Kielder Forest extends northwards on the western slopes of Deadwater Fell.
